title: Typeface needed for 70's ProgRock artwork
content:
I’m lost in space and need some cosmic vibes...  
Hopefully someone can help by  
suggesting a typeface to a prog-rock cover I need to  
make a concept for.  
The client has supplied the attached image  
and if referring to the type at the top and the bottom.  
But the cosmic type in the middle is amazing!

Can anyone suggest a suitable face?

Thanks in adavance

Mr Brown

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [cosmic space sound pic 2.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20070908172821/http:/typophile.com/files/cosmic%20space%20sound%20pic%202_0.jpg) | 391.74 KB |

 [‹ 1950's America typefaces](http://web.archive.org/web/20070908172821/http:/www.typophile.com/node/35303 "Go to previous forum topic") [Research on Dutch type design ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20070908172821/http:/www.typophile.com/node/35219 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Mr Brown

comments.content:
Thanks Jupiter!  
We did initially go for something clean and the client sent back  
the cosmic thing that I posted.  
I agree with finding a lot of diversity but sometimes clients  
can be real stick in the mud’s  
find something like this!  
[the swines]  
Thanks for you suggestions  
I think I got that Cope thing somewhere

Mr Brown

Look at Hawkwind in that case.

[http://www.starfarer.net/tshirt2.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20070908172821/http:/www.starfarer.net/tshirt2.html "http://www.starfarer.net/tshirt2.html")

[http://www.starfarer.net/tshirt3.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20070908172821/http:/www.starfarer.net/tshirt3.html "http://www.starfarer.net/tshirt3.html")

[http://www.starfarer.net/tshirt4.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20070908172821/http:/www.starfarer.net/tshirt4.html "http://www.starfarer.net/tshirt4.html")

[http://www.starfarer.net/tshirt5.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20070908172821/http:/www.starfarer.net/tshirt5.html "http://www.starfarer.net/tshirt5.html")

and for a contemporary take, look at [Malleus Rock Art Labs](http://web.archive.org/web/20070908172821/http:/www.malleusdelic.com/).

Faust had the best covers. And music.

But it certainly wasn’t space oriented.

pbc

“Faust had the best covers.”  
I would have to say Yes.

Faust IV is usually my suggestion for someone new to the genre. I’ve got little tolerance of guitar noodling. It is the pop sensibilities that shine through for me.

I often read that Wayne Kramer was highly influenced by Faust. Not surprising.

I’ve got a few of the Comic Jokers repressings that I appreciate as graphic design objects.

Get a bigger sample of covers. Look at Hawkwind, Amon Düül II, Faust, Can, Ash Ra Tempel, etc. You will find much diversity in the work. Remember that this music sprang from a reverence for the velvets not American blues.

If you can find a copy of Julian Cope’s Kroutrock Sampler take a look at that. It has lots of covers.

[Yeti](http://web.archive.org/web/20070908172821/http:/www.amazon.com/Yeti-Amon-Duul-II/dp/B0009LNRLE/ref=pd_sim_m_1/105-4287604-9198064) is one of the classics and it is pretty clean.
